title: Here’s Proof Some Pollsters Are Putting A Thumb On The Scale FiveThirtyEight » Features | FiveThirtyEight

type_specific.selection: It’s time to stop worrying about outliers and start worrying about inliers. Earlier this year, my colleague Harry Enten documented evidence of pollster “herding” — the tendency of polling firms to produce results that closely match one another, especially toward the end of a campaign. What’s wrong with the polls agreeing with one another? The […]
